column4: how do I list all .pl files in a directory, including in sub directories? I tried ls -R "*.pl" but it didn't work
ls: *.pl: No such file or directory
but there are definately .pl files in the sub directories
the grep didn't work I don't think, it listed everything
no, but now that you mention it. Yes "find" is the proper solution.
yeah you're right actually your's does work - it lists the .pl at the top, but then lists everything else. I could have worked with that

well for me, it doesn't list everything, just the files with extension .pl, although you have to remember that grep searches regular expressions which means they can appear in the middle of a file name.
it can be improved with "grep .pl\> " I think, so you can select starting or ending of a word.
- yeah, they all had .pl in it :) thanks
use "aptitude search" and "apt-cache search" as much as you can
